newsitem.title: USA: Survey finds U.S. workplace drug, alcohol use.
newsitem.headline: Survey finds U.S. workplace drug, alcohol use.

text.p: Six out of 10 Americans know someone who has gone to work under the influence of drugs or alcohol, according to a survey released Tuesday.

The poll found that nearly a third of those questioned thought a co-worker's job performance was affected by drug or alcohol use but less than one in five had ever approached a supervisor or the worker involved to discuss the situation.

The survey was released by the Hazelden Foundation, which operates drug and alcohol abuse treatment centers in Chicago, New York, Minnesota and Florida. It was based on a sample of 1,000 adults and had an error margin of plus or minus three points.
